Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: islandgirl2244
Reviews.Content: This was a hostel converted into 175 rooms hotel. On the plus side, It's in a good location, across from Fort Canning Park and a few steps from the MRT (Dhoby Ghaut Station on the Purple Line) and two shopping malls (Park Mall and Singapur Shopping Complex). It is also close to the major shopping road (Orchard Road) that sells all the designer clothing. Amenities include a large outside pool, baggage storage area, a gift shop and a complimentary mediocre breakfast. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. On the negative side, the hotel had a large lobby but nothing to sit on! There's no free internet service. They do provide internet service in a non private area in the lobby at a premium charge. The room with two small twin beds was small and smelled of smoke though designated as a non-smoking room. They offered to spray the room but never did. There was a small desk and a small fridge but no drawers to put your clothes in. The bathroom had only a bath towel; when asked about the wash cloths and hand towels, they stated that they do not provide that. There was only one electrical plug in the entire room which was controlled by the key card to your room. So if you have more than one electrical device to charge, you'll have to wait until you are in your room to charge it and can only charge one at a time. We were told that we got upgraded to an executive room. If this is what you get for an executive room, I'd hate to see what you'd get for a standard room! There's no taxi pull in to this hotel. I told the front desk that I needed a taxi to the airport early morning. They indicated that they would book a taxi for me. The taxi meter registered $14.85 to the airport but the taxi driver charged me $32 stating that the difference of $17 is the booking fee! Though I'd recommend this hotel for the location, I think it is overpriced for what you get. There are many surrounding hotels that offer better amenities for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean place”
Reviews.Author: vptsindia
Reviews.Content: The location is slightly away from Orchard Road which is slightly inconvenient for tourists. However rooms are clean and properly maintained. The total ambiance is like a hostel and one should not expect service like a hotel. The museum is in walk able distance. The tariff is possibly little high compared to the facility.

Reviews.Title: “A Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: LizzelBomediano
Reviews.Content: my family had a wonderful stay at your hotel. Its very clean, nice view from above.The skypark is very visible..The location is very near the mrt station and walking distance to Sacred Heart church...the staff are accomodating. My Kids loved the room we occupied. It's spacious and the bathroom is clean .However, we find the lobby so simple with no place to sit. I highly recommend your hotel to other travellers. For family of 5 get the executive room and you will never regret. Your stay in singapore will be a memorable one. Book now!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sdtoad19
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at the YWCA and really enjoyed our stay. It’s a very clean and reliable hotel. Big pool. There was hardly any noise from the renovations (we were on the 9th floor) and the rooms are nice and simple – no problems. We had a late night flight and the hotel had a secure room for our bags to stay after we checked-out. The best thing about the hotel is its location. It borders the park and we were easily able to walk to Clarke Quay in about 10 to 15 minutes. In the other direction, Orchard Road and all that it offers (e.g., Starbucks, restaurants, shopping) is nearby and easily accessible by foot depending on how far you want to walk. We spent most of our time walking Orchard Road and even felt safe coming back late at night around midnight. Public transit is also readily available as the hotel is a short 5 minute walk from the Dhoby Ghaut station. The directions we found to the hotel from Dhoby Ghaut from other travelers were very helpful and worth repeating – take the Park Mall exit and go towards the Park Mall building on the left; enter the building and take the elevator down to the 4th floor; exit the 4th floor to the parking structure and the hotel is directly in front of you; go left to exit the parking structure and walk around to the front of the hotel (it really is a lot easier than it sounds). We stayed here because it was one of the cheaper options for the area. It is a nice, dependable hotel. We easily recommend it and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice cozy place”
Reviews.Author: happy960
Reviews.Content: we been to singapore and stayed at ymca fort canning lodge, the front desk was an indian national the manager, he was so nice we just get a standard room but we arrived 11 am so the room was not available, but we said its our first time here so we want to maximize the time without any longer conversation he upgrade us to executive room without extra charge.The room is spacious and there is almost everything you need. for the socket go to little india at mustafa mall is only 2 singapore dollar, dont buy at 7 eleven its 7 dollar. In the morning breakfast is serve already by 630am buffet style there is western, filipino and chinese dishes to choose from. Beside the hotel is park mall enter and rode elevator to ground floor, then cross the street you can see the dhouby gaht subwaystation where you can ride to orchard road, to singapore zoo, to universal studio, raffales city and marina bay. The best part for me in singapore is, to walk to singapore flyer then connect to double helix bridge to marina sands and bay and end at esplanade its a relaxing moment go there around 4pm, try to eat at hawker area at the singapore flyer more clean and safe dont forget to try the bbq stingy ray, that the only one i try that is delicious, then take esplanade subway back to hotel. Always remember choose hotel near subway for any travel...

Reviews.Title: “Great place..”
Reviews.Author: twodeezz
Reviews.Content: great place to stay ... handy to the hop on hop off bus... rooms were clean and bed was comfy. breakfast was good with plenty of choice. there is a swimming pool we did not use as we ran out of time. staff were both friendly and helpful...good value for money. definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A good location and price”
Reviews.Author: LsBob
Reviews.Content: The YWCA Fort Canning Lodge is well situated near the Dhoby Ghat MRT station and also Orchard Road. Booking was done direct to the hotel so their was no commission charged on the bill, the only potential disadvantage is while they do let you know how many rooms are left, they ask for a 10% deposit which is non refundable if cancelled. On arrival the reservation was handled promptly even though we arrived earlier than we had stated and we were willing to leave our luggage there and come back later. Any queries were promptly handled by the desk. The room was adequate and contained 2 single beds pushed together. The is internet connection and by the table there was the Internet lead and plug. I did not use it nor did I see if it had Wifi. The neighbours were all quiet and the only noise was the door next door slamming a few times as the people left at 6 in the morning. As we faced Fort Canning Rd and was on the 11th floor there was no road traffic noise. Breakfast was included in the price and quite comprehensive catering for various tastes. Just across 2 streets are several shopping centres / food courts with a wide range of food available. It probably not suit young people who wanted a bar and night club/ entertainment as these are not available, so there is no noise from celebrations downstairs. There is also a swimming pool there but as it was raining quite often we did not use it. However I went for an early morning walk around the Fort Canning Reserve which is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: lanaval
Reviews.Content: The location is very convenient because it is just in front of the Fort Canning park where you can do your morning jog, an afternoon stroll or just getting to know some of Singapore's history. The Singapore National Museum is nearby, too. Just a few walk is the train station, a mall, and restaurants. If you are an avid shopper for branded products, just take a walk along Orchard Road which is very accessible. The room is basic but clean and comfortable enough. There are no bell boys to help carry your luggage but the front desk staff are supportive enough to answer your queries. Breakfast buffet is filling enough although some waiters are not that friendly. If you get hungry at night, the front desk can direct you to a 24-hour fastfood restaurant near the university.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: olatorres
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3days and 2 nights. they upgraded our room from standard room to premier room with king size bed without additional fee.. the hotel is in great location..very near in dhouby ghaut station.. i like their breakfast because its buffet with fruits, bread rice sausage ham and more.. the internet connection is not free.. its 9sin dollar for every hour.. rooms in higher floors have a good view of the city..

Reviews.Title: “...its home”
Reviews.Author: chansy
Reviews.Content: Always come to the Y when I visit. The homely atmosphere and location is hard to beat. Whilst I would never consider the Y cheap, but by virtue of its benefits such as location, cleanliness, swimming pool, gym and, diverse breakfast, I would consider it reasonably priced. Whilst I would like to book directly at the Y online, it has been a hassle. I look forward to improvements in that area. However, am not averse to booking through a travel agent. The night shift staff are the friendliest and Charmaine on the day shift has consistently represented the Y very well through her efficient, yet warm manner. Most other staff need to get beyond just being efficient. Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money-best possible location”
Reviews.Author: Fintraveller57
Reviews.Content: I chose Fort Canning Lodge because of the price. It was my first trip to Singapore and I learnt from Tripadvisor comments, that the location was good. But I as positively surpriced, when I arrived to the hotel. Most parts were renovated, also my room. The room was basic, clean, enough space, good view to the Fort Canning park. The renovation noice could be heard but only on daytime from 9 to 18. And the renovation lasts only to 15.4.2012. The breakfast was good. Wifi was working only in the lobby and there were no chairs or tables to work at. The best was the location. Dhoby Ghaut MRT was 5 min walk away. This station connects 3 MRT lines, so actually you can get from this station almost everywhere in Singapore. Little India, Chinatown etc are only one or some MRT stops away. Also you can get to and from the airport quite easily and very cheap with MRT. Only 3,20 SGD per way and you get 1 dollar deposit away from this price when returning the travelcard to the machine. And it takes about 50 minutes depending on the terminal you are going to or arriving. Also you can get from Woodlands with MRT. One tip for travellers arriving (from the airport) to the hotel. Take MRT to Dhoby Ghaut MRT station. Take the Park Mall exit. Up you can easily see the Park Mall. Enter the building. You'll find the elevators just in front of you. Now you are on the first floor. Take floor number 4. Enter the parking hall. Follow out signs to the left. Exit the building. Take 30 steps and you'll see the hotel on your right hand side. Tip for travellers arriving the hotel with

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star, but great value for your money”
Reviews.Author: solotravellerCanada
Reviews.Content: It's not a 5 star hotel, but heck, it doesn't pretend to be a 5 star hotel. 'The Y' provides clean, comfortable, and simple lodging for what is - by Singapore standards - a very reasonable price. It's a very solid 3 star hotel that offers good value for money. Internet is free, but not always fast. Complimentary coffee and tea s provided n the room. The bathrooms are large, recently renovated, and have simple but adequately sized amenities. The staff are friendly and efficient. The air conditioning works. The hotel is located very close by the Dhoby Ghaut MRT. I wasn't too impressed with the breakfast offering, but perhaps this is because I was looking for 'Western' food, and the breakfast buffet appeared to be primarily focused on Asian and Indian breakfast offerings. If you are looking for clean, simple lodging, with no hidden extra charges, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Sivanathan
Reviews.Content: This is only my second hotel review ever despite my travel experiences to more than 20 countries. Boy I just couldn't wait to write one for this hotel due to the terrible experience I had. Stayed here for 3 nights in early February 2012 and I didn't have a single good rest. Extremely noisy, poor noise cancellation from the corridors, noisy guests, noisy aircond, terrible TV (for the price that I paid), very bad pillows, bad bed qualities, terrible food and not-so-friendly hotel crew. For the price that I paid, I should have just paid a little extra dollars to stay at Hotel Fort Canning. The only plus point of this hotel is the great location but I wouldn't recommend to any of you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in $$$ Singapore”
Reviews.Author: KMSM44
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my husband, sister-in-law and her husband for 2 days. We loved the spacious rooms and the location. I was hesistant about the renovations but did not even notice it. The water pressure was divine and hot water was better in the mornings. In the late evenings, it ran out fast. The common corriders can get alittle noisy from loud neighbours but it all depends who is staying there. The first night, we slept early and had to wake up to loud, happy neighbours who had a couple of drinks in the wee hours of the morning. Ear plugs will help you sleep better. The second night, we had kids running along the corriders.... I guess ear plugs again will help you in that situation... Breakfast was simple but I loved it! Western and local were available. We chose YWCA for it's location and we will stay there in the future should the need arise.... Please note : The airconditioning can get really cold and it was hard to adjust the vents.... Also, my sister-in-law used their laundry and dryer - self service. She was grateful for that additional option as we were in the middle of our travels...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: rickurt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of Singapore. Easy walk almost anywhere. Close to Chinatown, Clark Quay, Orchard Road. We even walked to Little India from there. There is an MRT (subway) station really close. The area is simply beautiful, in the middle of the colonial district. The room was a bit small, but no one ever advertised this as a 5-star resort. For the price, in Singapore, it was great. Breakfst buffet was included and it was delicious (Continental and Asian menu). We visit Singapore very often. I think this will be our hotel every time we go there. Did I mentioned that the room was small?

Reviews.Title: “Singapore holiday by dpejis”
Reviews.Author: dpejis
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel. Spacious room (twin bed). Good location. Reasonably good buffet breakfast. Affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with lack of transparent costs...”
Reviews.Author: Lisa S
Reviews.Content: We booked for 3 adults + 1 child (9yrs) in a family room (clearly stated on our online booking) and upon late arrival found there were only beds for 3. We were charged an extra 80 SGD to have a roll-away bed brought to the room. We also found when the service and tax charges were added to our bill, our accommodation became unreasonably expensive. Whilst the staff were pleasant enough in handling our questions, we found the extra costs made our stay poor value for money and disappointing. Perhaps if the additional costs were more clearly stated upfront, we would've been less shocked. Despite our disappointment, the room was clean, spacious and breakfast was hearty. The location was very central and the metro easily accessible. It seems family accommodation with reasonable prices is difficult to find in Singapore. We thought the YWCA was a good find but beware hidden costs.

Reviews.Title: “CHEAP and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: aussieboy7747
Reviews.Content: Visiting alone and hotel was very comfortable with all mod cons and convenient to shops and MRT close by for visiting Sentosa Island via Harbourfront Station - would recommend for others on a budget. Only complaint was they had No comfy chairs to sit in and although they gave me late checkin at 1pm at NO EXTA COST I went very early to airport to sit in comfort

Reviews.Title: “$100 a day, Not Normally A Value! But This Is Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Lifetraveler1
Reviews.Content: Today I am in Singapore, yeah! It is someplace that I have wanted to visit for a long time. It has been about 21 hours of planes and transfers. But now I am settled! Looked for hotel rates before leaving the states! The average hotel was running $250 to $350 plus per night. Especially if you wanted to be near Orchard Rd, the main shopping and visitor area in the city. Using tripadvisor.com, support by some other websites, this YWCA Fort Canning Lodge came up with the best rates. So I decided to try it. Even though I guaranteed my room, with my arriving at 100am in the morning, I was concerned that my room may have been given away (that's happened before). But no, they had everything ready for me, so I was able to come in a crash. Location: This hotel is located at coordinates, N1 17 50.95,E103 50 41.59, near the Orchard Road shopping area. You go through the garage next door, take the elevator down to the first level, where you pop out in a mall. Across the street from the mall is the MRT Dhoby Ghaut, which sits on Orchard Road. This access, so easily to the subway train makes it easy for you to find your way around the central district. The Building: Looks to be about 12 stories tall, with a decent amount of vegetation surrounding it. It looks like it is in good shape and there was no reason to pause about going into it. The Lobby: Is very simple and plain, but it is clean and the staff that greeted me were very nice. There are two computers in the lobby for accessing the internet, however, there is a small fee, unless you room promotion included unlimited internet as part of the package.. Mine did. The Hallways: They were also simple, nothing fancy, but yet they were very clean. The Room: This room is rather small (see my photos) and the word plain comes to mine again. There are no textured walls, no photographs or pictures hanging on the wall. The flooring looks like a nice quality wood grain laminate. However, the lighting system is a little crazy. Once you come into the room, you have to stick your key card in a slot near your door. Only with the key card in this slot will the various lights come on and work. Once the key card is removed, the room goes dark if it is night. So you must remember to stick it in the slot as you are walking in the door. There is a safe in your closet for the room and that's good. The closet space is ample for two folks staying several days. There is only one decent size drawer to stick your dirty clothes in. There is a small fridge and a regular tube tv set, which appears to be about 19 inches. There is a desk with an 'ethernet' cable for your computer. Wireless is only provided downstairs in the lobby and dining area. The Bed: There are two in the room. The bed would be considered a little bit firm. but when you are tired, you really won't notice it. One of them has this very faint stain on the bedspread, but I'm not sleeping in that one. The Bathroom, It is also small. Two good steps in and you are already at the walk-in shower. However the facilities within the bathroom looked okay. The glass enclosed shower let's water bypass the glass door and it usually ends up on the floor in the bathroom, but nothing serious. Other Items: Internet is not free until it is part of your hotel package. Breakfast is included and it was pretty good. Besides typical Asian fare, they had items that most Americans would consider typical breakfast at home. Ants, yes let's talk ants. Between last night and tonight I have smashed up 6 of these very small, but very fast little ants. They ants appear on hard surfaces like the business desk, but not on the beds. I thought it was a hotel issue until I found them again at other places in city today. I saw them in restrooms in public buildings. My consensus is that $100 per nights is not a value. However, with other hotels costing three time more then yes, this is a value relatively speaking. I'd stay here again. Although I may look for a Hostel for the remainder of my stay. You can cut your cost in half.

Reviews.Title: “Delight all the way”
Reviews.Author: SurajitMitra
Reviews.Content: I was initially sceptical on this hotel after reading few negative comments about it. However we were not only delighted with the hotel, but will recommend it to everyone who visits Singapore and likes a simple, clean yet smart accomodation. We reached the hotel at 1pm and were promptly checked in by a smiling receptionist. Though we were 3 of us, our 9 yr old daughter was also given a breakfast clearance without any charges whatsoever. The room was a no-smoking one on the 11th floor facing the park with beautiful views right across the Esplanade. The room was just like any 3 star room should be.. with comfortable beds, wardrobe, fridge, TV, clean bathroom etc. The coffee/tea supplies were replenished everyday. Since we used to leave the hotel early in the morning for our sightseeing, the room service was never really a bother.. if you dont want to be disturbed, just hand the 'do not disturb' sign.. surprised how few comments spoke about cleaning ladies walking into the room every day without warning.. never faced this issue. The breakfast was extensive though almost the same every day.. but we loved it as it filled us up for the day.. lots of fruits, juices etc.. The hotel is on a hill behind Park Mall, and the lift from the parking to the road leading to the Dhoby Ghaut MRT took us just 5 min to enter the subway system.. it is so close.. also there is a bus stop right there and we got buses to almost everywhere from there. I would rate this property as a gem of a find in expensive Singapore as it is just 5 min to Orchard Road.. Plaza Singapura at Dhoby Ghaut has almost all kinds of food so eating around this location was not an issue at all. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: reet02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at YWCA Fort Canning Lodge for 3 nights in December and were very satisfied with our choice. We booked through Expedia and we chose this hotel because of its location and it had a free breakfast buffet. The room was very comfortable, clean and spacious for 3 persons. Breakfast buffet was good. The location was also great. It tooks us 15-20 minutes to walk to the centre Raffles or to Orchard Road shopping malls, yet the hotel was in quiet area next to the park. There was also a nice and big swimming pool that we used a couple of times during our stay. I absolutely recommend the place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Sans82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fort Canning Lodge in February and the main reason that we booked this accommodation is because of the great location and reasonable room rates for this area. The room was comfortable and clean with a good selection at breakfast and if you are just looking to use the hotel as a base then I would recommend that you stay there. The hotel is located just of off the main Orchard Road which you can walk to and the metro station that will take you to closeby attractions is just a few minutes walk away. It is not a luxurious hotel but is perfectly adequate and will allow you to explore Singapore very easily, simply due to the excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “It is an OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: liambeiwai
Reviews.Content: Generally speaking the hotel itself it is OK, the location is quite good due to the close distance to the Dhoby Ghaut MRT Station and the service is generally speaking quite good, but do consider those elements before booking this hotel: 1. It is under refurbishment now. The check-in staff first gave us a room which had no running water, we called the receptionist to solve the problem, she later assigned a plumber only to find out that the entire 5th Floor might have water problems, so they instead assigned us to a better room. 2. The noise of air conditioning might make sleeping harder, for light sleepers it is not quite a good choice and the TV is too small and sometimes the remote control does not work. But generally speaking the location and the service are above average.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for family stay”
Reviews.Author: Djongyonda
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, renovated, breakfast is ok, near dhoby gaut mrt and bus station. Dhoby gaut is linked to all downtown attractions. One minus point is that we have to go thru the Park Mall and it's parking lot but it is facilitated nicely though. AC is a little bit noisy and strong blowing

Reviews.Title: “Lacking in Service”
Reviews.Author: Jade820
Reviews.Content: Although the location was great -- just need to cross the street to Dhoby Ghaut MRT interchange station and Orchard road -- I found the price too steep for the service we received. The front desk staff need proper (and more) customer service training. They were okay enough (even without welcoming smiles and greetings, etc.) during check-in, but "service" apparently ends there. Also, you pay for everything you do and use. + Location Breakfast buffet was good enough - Not a very service-oriented "hotel" Rooms are clean enough but could be cleaner (We found ants in the bathroom upon check-in and on some days -- and it wasn't because of food) Expensive

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable for the location”
Reviews.Author: reviewsplus
Reviews.Content: Lack of an ATM makes this a tough location to deal with if you're faced with a cash situation as there are no banking facilities nearby unless you cut across through the Park Mall parking lot to the dhoby ghaut MRT station. This is also the way to the nearest set of malls such as Plaza Singapura a tedious but quick walk. Breakfast is fair and a decent selection of local and western. Catching a cab is not easy from this location and calling a cab is required most often. Rooms are quite good and well appointed with good bathrooms - ample space. Shared ironing and paid laundry facilities in the basement. Lift access was finicky and quite slow inspite of there being 3 lifts and only 12 floors. Overall value location although price would be better at a 100sgd would be good given whats on offer. Not a lot of time is spent inside hotels in singapore in my view - optimizing on location and access to options is by far most important. singapore can be a very expensive place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Gayan_Saparamadu
Reviews.Content: It is a good hotel with OK breakfast & nice swimming pool. We stayed at 11th floor & park view was really nice. Rooms had enough space for two adults & one kid. To use the lift, you need the key card when coming from lobby. The staff was OK & helpful when we wanted a cab. Check-in & Check-out was fast.

Reviews.Title: “good location but crapy hotel”
Reviews.Author: chasenp
Reviews.Content: we just spent 2 nights and know that the hotel was not so trendy Hotel is oldfashion but has nice swimming pool and is very well located (closed to subway and central) Breakfast , well if you like to be in the middle of the lobby on round table.... Positive points :location and rate + swimming pool Negative points: really old fashion and crapy

Reviews.Title: “The Best Value For Money in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: SingersTomTom
Reviews.Content: Fort Canning Lodge is one of those rare places which remains relatively unknown to the first time traveler to Singapore. Its location right next to Fort Canning Hill and a block away from the main thoroughfare of Orchard Road means that is one the the most convenient. Best of all, its prices are a fraction of what you would pay for a similar location in an Orchard Road Hotel. We stayed at Fort Canning Lodge for a couple of weeks as we prepared to leave Singapore after living there for four years. While it was true that our visit coincided with some renovation on the roof above, after we had changed rooms, we found the stay very satisfying and well worth the money. You can read my thoughts on Fort Canning and view a gallery of images here - http://singaporesojourn.blogspot.com/search?q=fort+canning The breakfast provided was good and it is an excellent spot for families and those with a limited budget passing through. The rooms are clean and the service excellent. It is not a backpacker hostel but rather a hotel for the budget conscious who appreciate value for money. Would I stay there again? Definitely. It may not be the most modern and fancy place but its location makes it a winner and the walks around Fort Canning reserve across the road make for a pleasant change from the shopping belt below.

Reviews.Title: “What's happening Gals?”
Reviews.Author: LUVBALIBEACH
Reviews.Content: We had just arrived from Bali and we decide to book with Hotelwithheart.com. We saw the website accidentally online and was eager to do some chariity work. Since the website boast of charity work, we decided to try. We booked YWCA cos of its location and the name. We found that its booking was actually manage by booking.com. The room was old & run down. We could see the badly damaged closet drawer. Water in the shower keeps running over to the rest of the bathroom.We believe drainage system was poor. There was also ants on table when we check in. Bathroom wall mouldy. Bed and sheet were clean though. Basic amenities were offered but there was no complimentary mineral water. TV was the smallest we have ever seen!Did not know they still make them so small;)Breakfast was good though. When phone messages were left with the operator it arrive late for the recipient. . Later, we saw a similar message. After sending the first message, they did not delete it so the same message was send again? The reception was manned by a trainee, and tone of voice seems as if she owns the YWCA. We watch her handle the rest of guests and was appalled by her tone voice. Kind of abrupt. ;( We hope the hotel will have proper training for the trainees.;0 We hope this hotel can improve in time to come.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and roomy”
Reviews.Author: Fiver75
Reviews.Content: Fort Canning Lodge was a big hotel, with a huge reception area downstairs and comfortable, uncluttered rooms. Staff were very efficient and friendly. Just minutes from Orchard Road and the Dhoby Ghaut MRT station, and with Fort Canning Park opposite, the location is perfect. My room was very clean and included the basics you would expect - a stocked mini-bar, safe, tea/coffee etc.. Internal noise was a bit of a problem - I was woken by other guests leaving in the early morning, as the noise of door slamming and footsteps in the hall come right into the room. Up until that point, however, I'd had a good nights sleep. Given that this is Singapore, the price was reasonable for what I got. Good hotel, great location!

Reviews.Title: “Look forward for the completion of renovaion”
Reviews.Author: ming962206
Reviews.Content: Location is good with greenery suruounding, atmosphere is very friendly. I will come back again after the renovation next May since the facilities are old, the TV is too small and you can use the internet with a fee only in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Scooterelli
Reviews.Content: Very good location in Orchard Rd. Not far from shopping also close to National Museum. Dhoby Ghoat MRT is also close by. Room is nice and clean. Basic function. Though the hotel was so crowded at that time but we had a very good sleep for 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “had a wonderful stay, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: yumcarrotcake
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, great buffet breakfast, very convenient location, nice and clean. I had to catch the early morning flight home, I was surprised that the staff sent me food. It was very thoughtful of them. Prior to our stay, we were communicating by email and they were quick to reply and very helpful. I have recommended this hotel to other members of my family and some of my friends. We had a very pleasant stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent”
Reviews.Author: fandorin
Reviews.Content: Proper hotel. We had tiny ants in the room attracted by a coffee cup we left but generally clean and comfy. Close to Orchard Rd, about 15 minutes walk to Merilion and the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for short stops, could get annoying for any longer!”
Reviews.Author: Boxxer
Reviews.Content: For the price paid this hotel was god for exploring downtown Vancouver. Say 15-20 min walk to waterfront and less to main shopping areas in downtown. Room was very clean, bed surprisingly comfortable despite being strangely high off the ground. Only annoying thing which is beyond the hotels control is how long next doors occupants spend in the shared shower and bathroom! 60mins is too long for a shower surely? Especially when you need to use the toilet. The two door system is easily secured from within the bathroom. Saying that the mess they left it in was excellently cleaned upon our next return!

Reviews.Title: “Very Mediocre but fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: 67suns
Reviews.Content: YWCA was extremely busty--people in and out constantly. The staff were just so so--not very friendly or helpful. The rooms were small and plain. The cleaning staff did an OK job. However, the plus side is that the location was perfect. Quck access to everything--very central.

Reviews.Title: “I would think to stay back”
Reviews.Author: Putri70
Reviews.Content: Our 2 night stay at the YWCA Fort Canning Lodge. If never stay here, rather difficult to find, but located just behind Park Mall. Clean and new rooms in the up grade. The bathroom is clean, modern, towels changed every day. Breakfast ok but staff a bit rough when we asked whether the food contains pork or not. Because we are moslem of course we are looking for halal food. before the check out tomorrow morning, I had to report to the officer the night before and he promised to wrap the breakfast for us because the restaurant is not open yet, but when check out, breakfast is promised does not exist. officials previously said the officer did not leave a message..

Reviews.Title: “Basic accommodation suited for families”
Reviews.Author: JKE255103
Reviews.Content: Executive room is large and can accomodate 2 extra beds. Be sure to book extra beds early as they run out. Close to MRT and buses. Just basic. Pool is nice and long for swimming laps. Breakfast is basic but feeds the stomachs.

Reviews.Title: “Location plus swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: Aklu
Reviews.Content: I stayed there one night only on a way to Europe. It was very important for us to have a good night sleep as we stayed in SIngapore the whole next day, as the flight was late at night. The hotel location was excellent, near a lovely green park, where you could go for a walk on a hot day. The room on a 12th floor would provide a lovely view of the city. The room was simple but big and it had tea and coffee facilities. After a great breakfast (which is included in a room price) and morning walk in a humid park, we had a dip in the pool and it was very refreshing. After checking out we could leave the luagage in the hotel storage for free right to the evening. I enjoyed the stay, but I still think it was overpriced especially that you have to pay taxes and one time YWCA membership on the top of the room rate. Well, we could not find anything cheaper around.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a place close to the metro”
Reviews.Author: bobchatterji
Reviews.Content: Not wanting to pay a fortune while staying close to the Orchard road during the peak Christmas season, hit upon this hotel. Though there is a one time charge for non YWCA members the overall rates are very competitive compared to the other options in the location. The other budget options being in Geylang was ruled out for travelling with the family. The best part of the hotel was its proximity to the Dhoby Ghaut interchange(metro station) which armed with your Transit Card puts the entire city at your disposal. The brilliant transportation network of the city helps you in visiting all the attractions of the city including the Night Safari, Zoo & Jurong Bird Park easily accessible. Please ask the front desk for the shorter route to the station through the parking lot of the adjoining shopping mall City Hall. There is no need of opting for expensive day tours for these attractions as they only arrange for a pick up & drop for which you are expected to pay a bomb. All the entry tickets are available online & if you have time by a 3 park hopper but donot try more than 2 in a day, as the walks are quite long.While for Sentosa it is recommended to go on a tour package unless you decide to stay in the resort/closeby atleast for a couple of days. It's too big to cover all of it in a day. Another must see close by is the Singapore National Museum which is a great attraction. The restuarant offers decent value options for basic fare during lunch & dinner while the inclusive breakfast buffet is wholesome

Reviews.Title: “Very tired - in need of some TLC”
Reviews.Author: happyholiday08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights - it is far cheaper than most hotels in Singapore and we chose it as we were on our way home after a cruise - so only wanted somewhere to sleep while we spent most of our time exploring Singapore. The staff were all very nice, but the hotel is in need of some TLC - we stayed on the 6th floor and as soon as you got out of the lift it smelled very musty. Our room was similar, but not quite as bad. The room was very basic, two single beds only - we were informed they don't do doubles & when we asked if the beds could be joined - that's exactly what they did - pushed them together - still made up as singles!! The bathroom was very mouldy, but kept very clean. It suited our purpose, but I certainly wouldn't choose it if I were to stay there for a 'holiday'.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy; just a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Martnievs
Reviews.Content: Here are my personal views of this hotel: Pros - cheap by singapore standards, staff was nice and helpful, clean and tidy beds, food is ok (although they served the same menu on two consecutive days of our stay), location is very good for joggers. Cons - location is a little bit far from the nearest mrt station and you always have to pass to a parking garage and a mall to get there, there were ants in the bedroom, the cabinets were old, air conditioning took one day to make our room cold, minibar is checked daily by staff (which is annoying, when you are resting), taxis don't regularly pass the front road. It was a so-so experience, but would probably stay in another hotel in singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good only for the location”
Reviews.Author: IzzyKL
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times due to the location of the place which is very near Orchard Road (walking distance - if you don't mind walking uphill back to the hotel). However as of late there has been a lot of other hostels/cheap hotels that are offering a more competitive price for about the same standards within reasonable locations. Personally my opinion of the place has also changed over the years due to this. Although Fort Canning Lodge would still fall under the 'budget hotel' category, based on the room prices you would be expecting a slightly better situation than what they have to offer. My last visit here was perhaps the worst of the many times I've stayed. The first room we were assigned to had a musty smell like mould + cigarettes, bathroom sink had a lot of limescale stains (possibly from age) and a few unsightly hairs over the floor. After inquiring about room availability we were assigned to a different room at a better location with slight improvement. Not one to be too picky when staying 'on a budget', I would just say that the cleaners were perhaps just not too thorough when cleaning the bathrooms. Other than that, the room as a whole was satisfactory, although perhaps a little overpriced compared to other budget places and quite small. Staff are not too friendly, but not particularly rude or anything like that. Parking can be quite a hassle as they only allow a one-time FOC entry/exit, which is a problem for those who need to go in and out frequently. There is no free WiFi available, but there are several computers provided on the ground floor with internet access charged at a rather expensive hourly rate. On that note, I would only recommend this hotel if you like the location or have a need to stay close to Fort Canning for an event.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't recommend it”
Reviews.Author: snowkitten3
Reviews.Content: This hotel got my boyfriend and I through our stay in Singapore, but I would not recommend it. The hot water lasted for 5 minutes, the rooms and hotel in general was just old.. from the carpets to the very bleak and simple rooms. What stands out the most, (which I hope does not happen often!), was that there was a fire alarm in the hotel at around midnight one of the nights. We were on the eleventh floor and took the stairs all the way down to the lobby with children and elderly people, only to watch the hotel staff run around talking to eachother, while no one seemed to know what was going on. After about a half hour, with no real explanation as to what happened, only being told that it was ok to go back to our rooms, we all went back. Needless to say, they should handle situations like this better.. There were a few goods things about this hotel. The breakfast was the best part. It was free and not too shabby, with eggs, hashbrowns, fruit, sausage, toast, coffee and also local options. The location is good because it is close- a 5 minute walk- to the Dhoby Ghaut subway and Clarke Quay. The window in our hotel was alright too. Overall I would not recommend this hotel to anyone who likes a nice hotel and a warm shower. If you are a budget traveler, who does not care about a short shower and hotel decor then this would be alright.

Reviews.Title: “bad experience”
Reviews.Author: travelmesenseless1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the lodge for laneway music festival on 29 january 2011. The place is perfect location-wise as the festival was held in fort canning park which is a 5 minutes walk from the lodge. However, we had a terrible stay at the hotel. The hotel is over-priced for "budget" hotel. Room was very basic and outdated, the floor was quite sandy when we first entered the room. For the price that we paid for this room, we could've experienced a 5 star treatment in Kuala Lumpur. After the festival ended at night, the guard was terribly rude to the guests and were practically chasing us out and were questioning us whether we were the guests of the hotel. Please bear in mind that if we had not been guests, we would not have come to this uninviting hotel for no apparent reason. Early in the morning of the check out day, room service knocked on our door twice to check on the mini bar. They could've at least waited until we have checked out like other hotels and charge us accordingly. We checked out early the next day and we did not mind not having breakfast there as it would pro-long our bad experience. We were totally put off by this hotel and would not recommend any of our friends and relatives to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location at reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: lollypork
Reviews.Content: If you're planning to stay at the YWCA, keep your expectations modest and you'll be fine. Yes there was mustiness, rooms were basic, aircond was slightly wonky and breakfast was generous tho not 5 star, but you get what you pay for and it's good value in this part of the pricey city state. Location is great -situated just behind ParkMall overlooking Fort Canning Park and its greenery,it's quiet enough, yet just a short walk to Dhoby Ghaut MRT and Orchard shopping bliss. Having stayed at the YMCA, the rooms here are a lot more spacious but we did miss the free wi-fi which I hope YWCA management will seriously consider throwing into the package.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here”
Reviews.Author: greynomads95
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here in September 2010 and were really happy with the hotel. It was easy for us to book direct and online and we got the best price that way. The breakfasts were really good and set us up for a days travel. Room was quiet, pool was a welcome relief to the heat and the staff were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: quicksand224
Reviews.Content: We stayed at YWCA Fort for four days. The room was not large but basic & bed was comfy. A bit smell but I told the staff and it’s well done. The buffet breakfast was ok. The staff spoke English not so well but very friendly. Nothing such a proble during our stay. Would recommend the hotel and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: kiwian
Reviews.Content: This is a very basic hotel with rather tired furnishings. It felt like a hostel disguised as a hotel. The bare floors did not help with atmosphere! Our room had a shower that did not drain well and water collected and rose up to our ankles during showering. The shower door that was hung incorrectly allowed water to splatter outside of the shower.The wash basin also did not drain well. Location is its biggest advantage being only a 10 min pleasant walk from the central Dhoby Ghaut subway. There was a wide selection for breakfast although it was of mediocre quality and we got bored of the selection after the 2nd day. I would not stay there again but will try for better value for money. As for location, the transport system in Singapore is so good that a hotel near any MRT station would be suitable to easily get around Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good family rooms”
Reviews.Author: dcpearse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the YWCA Fort Canning as it was one of the few Hotels in Singapore that had Family Rooms. Great location next to the Fort Canning Park. Smelt very musty, especially the Lobby area, but we got used to it after a couple of days! Large rooms, very clean, beds comfy, not much in the way of a view. Big pool that appeared well-maintained. Standard Asian Buffet Breakfast, with lots of variety. Some of the Reception Staff a bit difficult to understand, but mostly good.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, functional and great location”
Reviews.Author: RajPatro
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Fort Canning Lodge during my trip to Sinagpore in May, 2010 to attend a conference. I was looking for a clean and comfortable within my budget of below $100 per day. Except for free WiFi, I got everything I wanted with the added benefit of staying very close to the Dhoby Ghaut MRT station.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is home away from home- to me and my family.”
Reviews.Author: LeoMP
Reviews.Content: This hotel is home away from home- to me and my family. Reception personnel and other hotel staffs are very efficient and helpful.Breakfast is good and restaurant staffs are courteous and considerate. The souvenir store personnel are also kind, giving good discounts on souvenir items.All hotel facilities are very clean. Location is perfect, A short walking distant to Douby Ghout MRT stn .Orchard Rd is few meters away where shops and malls are located. Highly recommended! I will again choose to stay in this hotel on my next visit to Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: jhllmllr
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean as was the room. Beds were comfortable. Breakfast was free and the food was good, a buffet with dishes acceptable to SE Asians as well as Americans. The staff were helpful - our taxi was ordered and arrived ontime at 3:00 in the morning. Our friends who live in Singapore said that the cost of the room was very low compared to that of other hotels in the city. The staff were amenable to leaving the power on in the room while we were absent so that my wife's medications could be refrigerated. The only downside was that, since we are from the USA and are used to having hand towels and washcloths available in the hotel rooms, these were not available.

Reviews.Title: “ok value for money”
Reviews.Author: Titus80
Reviews.Content: Check in was a little slow as there was only one girl behind the desk and about 4 different parties wanting to check in. Room itself had a dorm feel and was a little basic and outdated, but was clean and comfortable. Hotel location is fairly close to Orchard road (5 mins taxi ride) and is behind a shopping mall and MRT station, which are about 5 mins walk away. Only negative is that sometimes quite hard to flag down taxis at certain times but get the main desk to call you one. Would be ideal for budget travellers

Reviews.Title: “Poor for the price”
Reviews.Author: Liucija
Reviews.Content: You have to pay additionally for the internet connection 5 SGD/30 minutes. Ok location and breakfast, but we found a strange smell in the room and very noisy air conditioner. The staff during the night shift was not helpful. For the same price we would suggest to take another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jekoy
Reviews.Content: Okay, the pictures in the internet really looked great, and a lot of people gave good reviews, but the final decision was based on price. We were staying for 7 days and 6 nights, so we'd rather use our money for other things rather than in a 5-star hotel. When we got there, we hardly recognized the place. We got in, and the lobby was huge but plain. No problems at all with our reservations, and there were 3 elevators which made sure there wasn't a long wait. When we got to the room though, first thought, "Dormitory!" We asked for a double and single bed for me, my wife and twelve year old daughter. We got 3 single beds instead. The room hardly had extra space. The floor was parquet and bare. There was a single window facing the pool side, a table with a water kettle, a small TV, and a small bathroom. But the closet was huge! And there was an empty refrigerator! None of those little cans and bottles that cost a fortune eating up precious space! But, since all we planned to do in the room was keep our stuff safe and sleep in, we agreed. For the price, it was great. The hot water was hot and the air-conditioning was cold. We went outside for our first look around the place, and discovered how wonderful the surrounding area was. We were right in front of Fort Canning Park, and beside us was the parking lot of the Park Mall where we went through to get to Dhoby Gaut Station, which was an intersection of all the train routes!!! So we could get anywhere from there! Breakfast the next day was very filling, and though it wasn't varied too much, it was very satisfying. There were cereals, rice, pasta, dimsum, eggs, salads and fruits, with either sausages or bacon. The coffee was brewed very well and the milk was fresh. For a 3-star, it was worth it. And the area was central to wherever we wanted to go. We could walk to Orchard Road if we wanted to. Will we go back? Yes, we will. We saved so much money staying there and had a blast in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again based on location”
Reviews.Author: RobW_NZ74
Reviews.Content: Its an average hotel, with a bed to sleep in. and based on Singapore costs its at the cheaper end. The staff were ok, not ultra grumpy, and not ultra friendly either. The biggest advantage this hotel has is the location. The MRT (train system) really is just a few minutes walk away. Use the Park Mall Car Park or Penang Lane to reach Orchard Road. I wouldnt want the trains to be any closer. And Fort Canning Park, across the road, is a nice walk through parkland to reach Clarke Quay for resturants (20 minutes walk here)... I would stay here again next time I am in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “clean and honest service, easy access to mrt station, and a beautiful treed park”
Reviews.Author: zane65
Reviews.Content: my friend and i were first time visitors to singapore and found the ywca in a great location, its was a 4 minute walk-cut thru the carpark of 'park mall' and take the elevator to the first floor, and your at the front doors, cross the road and your there-'dhobi gat' mrt train station (and use the mrt-its a breeze- quick and airconditioned). our stay at the y was comfortable once we got the pillows sorted, and having the pool was refreshing! our room was secure with a room safe, and always tidied on our return from a day of sightseeing and shopping. the staff were pleasant and always coutreous if asked for something..

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: soccer_crazy011
Reviews.Content: Cons: 1) WIFI... you need to pay in order to use it. :( 2) Bed and pillows are so hard. 3) Toilet does not have bidet. 4) HIDDEN CHARGES! Pro: 1) Food is good. 2) Easy access to train station.

Reviews.Title: “boring, time-warped and inaccessible”
Reviews.Author: edna_aquino
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and it's certainly not value for money. Paid Singapore $186/ night for a fairly large room - with an ante room which we didn't ask and never got to use. It's quite a distance from public transport and for an asthmatic 58 year old, I found it difficult to go up and down the hill to reach the place. The hotel staff are not friendly. Breakfast is boring - same stuff every day. It's like eating in a university cafeteria. Worst - internet access is expensive. Room is generally clean though but spartan.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fair price”
Reviews.Author: superkikay
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at a nice rate for an overnight stay for me and my mom. Compared to other hotels in the same area, the price is great. Checked-in past 4pm since we came from Universal Studios, it was a breeze. Paid SG$3 and some odd cents for a temporary membership fee. Location is great since its a couple of meters away from the Dhoby Ghout MRT station and from Orchard Road. There's the Plaza Mall next to it as well. The room was clean but really basic. It smelled like a really old hotel room and not much in a good way. Kinda smelled like molds. Buffet breakfast was satisfactory, a bit bland though. I'd recommend this hotel for the budget traveler or if you prefer a hotel with a nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous1086
Reviews.Content: Trust me this hotel is landed at great location if you wish to travel using MRT because the Dhoby Ghaut station is the three interchange of MRT lines . For someone who is new to Singapore, just few minute foot walking to National Museum and Fort Canning Park. It is a great experience to explore Singapore history after you drop down all the heavy luggage. Hotel package is come with variety food of breakfast buffet. Hotel is clean and tidy. One thing I just didn't satisfy is the air-cond fan sound but it didn't affect so much on me except you are the one who easily awaken up tiny sound.

Reviews.Title: “worst experience”
Reviews.Author: samantmck
Reviews.Content: This was by far one of the worst experience i have ever had staying in a hotel. Firstly, before arriving i emailed the hotel to make sure we had booked a room to stay in for the first night as we arrived at 2am. On arrival they said they had no booking but they would arrange us a room anyway. The person at the counter would not take a cash deposit, however said that we could put the deposit on my debit card and when we paid in the morning it wouldnt effect my card. However, the next morning when we returned to pay the full balance they said the bank would withhold the full amount owed on the room for the whole stay until it was cancelled so the money would not be available for 4 to 5 days (the duration of our stay). As if it wasnt bad enough to be left with close to no spending money, a note was left in our room to advise us that renovations would be carried out and there may be noise between 1 to 4pm. On our 4th morning at 9am it sounded like someone was jackhammering through the wall above our head. This went on for about 2 hurs whilst we were trying to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: austandtheworld
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in mid-July. Choose this hotel as it was close to Orchard Road and MRT and have stayed at other YMCA/YMCA hotels in Australia, This was just a one nighter between the end of our cruise and flying home. Had stayed in other Singapore hotels before the cruise. The hotel location made it easy for us to get any last minute shopping done. We had booked a 2 room family unit and it is third cheaper that other major hotels. Rooms were large and clean. Bathroom was spotless. Wish we had stayed here all the time. Room had the best pillows in Singapore! Access to Orchard road and the Dhoby Ghaut MRT station is via the Park Mall shopping centre. Checkin was quick and easy and there is a Christian book shop in the foyer. Due to our travel arrangements we had to use the internet in the foyer (I think it was 5SGD per 30 minutes). Unfortunely the airline site or the hotels internet connection was slow and we didn’t finish our changes. The staff gave us an extra time for free. This is when we found that it was the airline site that was having trouble. We decided to try again in an hour timer We came back to try again (this was at 10pm) and when we went to pay for another connection they could see our grief and gave it to us free again. As our new international flight was to be at 8.00am we would need to leave the hotel at 5.30. We arrange to have a wake up call at 4.30am so that we could try the website again. The call came through on time and the website worked this time. As we had arranged for an early check-out the hotel provided us with a breakfast pack of sandwiches, fruit drink and apple and phone a taxi for us. We found all of the staff over 3 shifts that we were there to be very helpful and friendly. This hotel may not suit most people as it is fairly basic, but it is comfortable and well managed. The walls are thin so there is some room noise but no traffic noise. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: hinau
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice in a two month period. Its very expensive for what it is, but excellent value in the Singapore scheme of things. Had an upgrade the second time, very pleasant room. Pool is great. The internet is dial up speed. They arranged an early monring taxi -very efficent and reasonable and gave us a packed breakfast box, which we happily munched once we checked in at the airport. We like the location. Just walk through the carpark of the Shopping Mall adjacent - into the lift and across the road to the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading photos on website”
Reviews.Author: KoStargazer
Reviews.Content: Yesterday I happily booked a room stating it was for 3 people, at Fort Canning Lodge, Singapore. I am traveling with my 2 children aged 8 & 11 for a 5 night stay. I looked & read everything on their website, they showed a photo of a room with what without doubt appears to be a double/queen bed & a single. They also stated that “a child may stay for free if using existing bedding”. Today I emailed the hotel to confirm that we would be 3 people, only to be told that the 3rd person would have to pay $70 ++ extra per night as there were only 2 single beds in the room ..... unless of course 2 people were to sleep together in a single bed !! Further more, when questioned about the photos on their website, I was told that the photos appeared to show a large bed due to fact that "the picture angle was from the side of the room" Needless to say that they do not want to refund me my 10% deposit. I am only thankful that I discovered the true nature of this hotel straight away, 10% deposit is a small price to pay for what would have surely been a very uncomfortable holiday. I will now book for 3 people at another hotel which will honestly quote me & show realistic photos on their website :) ** EXCITING UPDATE ** ..... Now 4 days later I have booked, (through asiarooms.com), a deluxe room at the 5 star hotel Marina Mandarin which is located on Raffles Boulevard overlooking the harbour for the same price for the 3 of us, as what it was going to cost me at Fort Canning Lodge with the extra bed. My room at Marina Mandarin is for 3 people and has stunning harbour views .... All I can say is thank Goodness I emailed Fort Canning to check on the booking & cancelled once they told me how much extra a third bed in the room was going cost me..... all in all they have done me a huge favour. I am now soooooooooo excited about my Singapore trip & staying in a luxury 5 star hotel 

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for relaxation and shopping as well”
Reviews.Author: Cel77
Reviews.Content: Staying at YWCA Fort Canning during our short trip to Singapore was a great experience. It is near Orchard Road where you see almost endless malls to shop in but the whole place in itself is also ideal for relaxation since the rooms are clean, spacious and well-kept. The buffet breakfast was well-chosen and has a wide array of asian and western cuisine. Their serving of a variety of fruits and juices is commendable. I will definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends who would want to enjoy a mix of rest, relaxation and shopping in the trendy and lively city of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: TriniAussie
Reviews.Content: Cheap ting no good, and good ting no cheap. So the saying goes anyway. But, alas, we all hope that we are "getting good value for money" and have "scored a great deal". Often times we do indeed find a great deal online and are pleasantly surprised (see my review on the Royale Chulan Hotel in Kuala Lumpur, for example). This time though, we were disappointed, and regretted not paying extra for a better hotel. I only have myself to blame though, as I did not research this properly and I did not heed the advice of my fellow posters on Tripadvisor. Overall, the room had the feel of a run-down motel. Cheap and tacky furniture, CRT television, small and dirty bathroom with not the nicest toiletries, dirty towels, a view of a parking lot, no bell-boy, limited breakfast buffet dishes, not the best location, an aircondition unit that never really cooled the room, no heater and iron board, no room service, no wifi, no robes and slippers, no bathtub etc. All in all, if you are a seasoned traveller and are accustomed to the nicer 4 and 5 stars, then avoid this place like the plague, and pay for better accommodation. If you are on a tight budget and just want a place to rest your head at night, then this place can probably pass. As my wife commented, this place is ideal for university students on vacation, or for a visiting school football team etc. I have learnt my lesson, and I will not be staying here again, or recommending it for a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: srakovska
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for shopping, not far from Orchard Ave (be aware of a walk up the hill). Clean and the room was surprisingly spacious. Also used the pool quite a bit, you'll appreciate it after walking around the city all day long.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good and quiet location”
Reviews.Author: philflieger
Reviews.Content: - Fast Service at the counter - Clean and comfortable rooms - Nice pool on the top floor (refreshing after a stressful shopping trip)

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away From This Place. Staff's response is slow and Food and Beverage Manager is Extremely Rude”
Reviews.Author: freedomlover7
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this place. No doubt the price is cheap, but facilities are run-down...cover sheets for chairs and table cloths are torn and stained...these are just some examples. Moreover, staff's response is slow and even the Food and Beverage Manager's service attitude is horrible and extremely rude.‎ When complaint was made, explanations given by the manager were to justify themselves rather than doing anything to solve the problem. It is only when I had to repeat myself at least 3 more times before he is willing to do something to help, and still trying to justify himself and his staff in the end... If you ask me how is the customer service of this place...my answer is "What customer service?"

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: cliffh
Reviews.Content: Accommodation in Singapore is expensive, so it was a pleasant surprise to find a clean, quiet and comfortable hotel at a reasonable price. The big bonus is that Fort Canning is handy for visiting much of central Singapore - my wife and I had no trouble walking to Orchard Road, Chinatown and Little India. And rail and bus are only five minutes away. Breakfast is banal but plentiful. Fort Canning isn't the Ritz, but neither will it break the bank balance.

Reviews.Title: “A well-located budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loth
Reviews.Content: The YWCA Fort Canning Lodge is a budget hotel and as always you get what you pay for. Our Executive Room was clean with a small bathroom and adequate storage space. The only "luxury" item was a safe. The fridge stocked some minibar items and was rather big, so it was easy to put our own purchased drinks in. The air conditioning was noisy and could not be regulated with the in-room thermostat. It could be switched off, though. If you need air conditioning and are in any way sensitive to noise, earplugs are a necessity at night. The breakfast buffet offered a choice of American, Asian and Continental items. Taste was OK for most items we sampled. Glasses, cups and cutlery were sometimes in short supply. It was always busy at breakfast time and seats were not easy to come by. We found that coming a bit later (8:30 instead of 7:30 or 8:00) helped as many tour groups were staying at the hotel and their buses started to depart at 8:30. All in all an unexceptional hotel but good value if you are one of the "I don't care about the room, I only sleep for a few nights" types. The location close to Orchard Road is the main attraction here.

Reviews.Title: “Value in good locationa”
Reviews.Author: muchachitaoz
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying here as we got stuck because of the volcano crisis.It ended up being quite pleasant. The room was very spacious & they promptly brought the additional bed. The air con worked well & the pool helped us cool down. They have a washing machine & drier in the basement to use which cost $12, but is certainly better value than hotel linen service. Breakfast was not great. They sting you for the internet. As a YWCA it is expensive but by SIngapore standards it seemed good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Rude Housekeeping Staff, NO FREE INTERNET””
Reviews.Author: DilanthaS
Reviews.Content: Book through local travel agent triple room for 2 nights. First day we checked in to the hotel was not prepared for triple, I inform housekeeping for extra bed and other requires stuff for 3rd person and housekeeping staff who pick the phone was very rude (other housekeeping staff barely speak English). 2nd we got a real triple room however no hair dryer. Hotel is in good shape. For the price we pay fewer facilities such as no free Internet and checking/checkout time is a rip-off. I recommend the hotel subject to fixing above complains.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: NatureLoverVV
Reviews.Content: Before booking this hotel, I searched here and some of the review stated that the room is dirty, smelly, the staff is not friendly... so on. But as I can't book another hotel with reasonable price (to be franked, Sg 140 per night with such facilities and service is not reasonable at all) in Easter holiday and I think maybe only one or two guests have unpleasant experiences and the locality of this hotel is gd, just try to have a look! When we entered the room, there is a strong smell in the room, the toilet had bad smell, the sink is dirty, OMG! This is one of the worse hotel I have ever stayed. And the air conditioner are very noisy, always have a sound like "boiling water". We were sleepless for the whole night. And in the mid night, the security alarm rang for three times! When I was calling the front desk staff the next day early morning, see whether they can send sb to check the air conditioner and ask for the possibility to change the room, his response is so cold and his tone is flat and said it is very subjective of whether sb feel it is noisy or not. And so far i was the first guest to complain about that! There is no big difference for me to change the room as it is central air-con. Still, I insist and request to reserve another room for us. Eventually, we changed into another room, though it is still smelly but at least the sound is relatively quiet. If you don't mind the service or the room condition and the cleanliness of what a hotel room should have, or you may have very poor sleeping quality, you can choose to stay here as the only merit of this hotel is the location is gd, not far from the main road and MRT station.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Option.”
Reviews.Author: HonestReviewEngland
Reviews.Content: Second stay at the YWCA and similar experience to before. Generally friendly staff (although the man who took our baggage to the 'holding-room' was rather pushy) clean room with a great view over Canning Park, and an excellent location for Orchard Road. The breakfast was ok, but most of the food- although brought out hot - is left to go cold with no heated trays. Cold fried eggs are not the most appetising start to the day. For the money though, it is probably the best accommodation with breakfast near Orchard road.

Reviews.Title: “Good inexpensive accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Riverdale17
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located within 5 mins walk of the MRT and Orchard Road. The rate included breakfast which was a plus. We had lovely views from our room over the city. Room size was good with air con. Staff friendly and helpful. All in all, given the cost, this is a good tourist class hotel. If you have arrived on Sinagpore Airlines you can, for the payment of $S6 each get a hoppa ticket on their round the city bus which is good value.

Reviews.Title: “great location, rude staff, no free internet”
Reviews.Author: dashie22
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for 5days and 4nights. The room was a bit dated but fairly clean, the bed was comfortable, although the TV only had 10 channels and the bathroom was very small. The free breakfast buffet was okay, although they had the same food everyday. The people at the front desk were a bit rude when we called if we could borrow a universal adaptor for our electronics, they just told us to come down to the front desk and they hung up. They have NO FREE WIFI and they charge 5dollars for 30minutes of internet! Good location though, 5minutes away from MRT station and within walking distance to Orchard Road through park mall back entrance.

Reviews.Title: “unimpressed, but satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: Izrii
Reviews.Content: The rooms are basic but still clean and comfortable. The shower in my room was very problematic. The door would not close completely, so the floor mat would get soaked. The water temperature was very erratic, as was the spray equally hard to maintain and control. On the plus side, the location of this hotel is good, just a few minutes walk to Orchard Rd. You can only take the shortcut through Park Mall (and its carpark) during the day, and going the long way around and up the hill is a little annoying (not to mention a wee bit exhausting after a long day, or if you're like drunk).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Quite Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: jewelicious
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fort Canning Lodge for 5 days while we visited a couple allergy doctors for our 3.5 year old daughter. The room that we had was the family room. It was a good size room for 3 adults and 1 child. There are 2 parts of the family room, the living/pantry area and the bedroom plus bathroom. The sofa in the living room can be converted into a double bed so 2 adults can comfortably sleep on the sofa bed. There are 2 TV sets in the room, 1 in the living room and another in the bedroom. The pantry is good for simple brewing coffee and washing dishes. There are also self-operated washing and drying machines at the basement, which are especially useful if you travel with small children as you don't need to bring so many clothes for change. The room was kept clean at all times, toiletries were refilled every day. As there is no carpeting in the room (only hardwood floor), YWCA is perfect for allergy sufferer. The AC is individually controlled for each the living room and the bedroom but at night we turned off the AC and opened the window, and still could sleep comfortably. The breakfast was okay, American breakfast of eggs, sausage, hashbrown were always available. Other items on the menu such as pancakes, waffle, and porridge were also available. Service was okay, the uncles were quite helpful in explaining directions, ways to get around, and even hailing cabs for us. The only negative was the location, which is not bad for adults but could be challenging for small children to travel on foot. For adults, it's about 5 minute walk to the Doby Ghaut MRT station as well as to Plaza Singapura. Do consider to take a stroller with you if you consider staying here with your small children. Overall, a good and efficient stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “Not a place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ElderZimpok
Reviews.Content: This is not a place to stay if you like clean rooms, friendly staff, and a respectable breakfast. The ac was noisy and could not reach acceptable temperature even if you set the thermostat to 0 degree C. The staff does not know how to be friendly and helpful. The shower door is designed to hurt your hand. The bedsheets were not acceptable. The pillows smelled. The breakfast only had white bread (and some other useless things, which one dare not try). Tea was hot, and OK. The fruits, not bad. After a two nights we went to Crowne Plaza at Changi Airport and were very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: pablo808
Reviews.Content: Then YWCA is a little dated and has probably seen better days but is cheaper than many of its competitors. The rooms are dated but secure, large and clean. The location and breakfast are very good and the staff are very helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants a decent hotel at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Vacaciones Encantador”
Reviews.Content: Just to share with you all on my experience at YWCA Fort Canning Lodge Hotel. This hotel is quite convenient and it is located behind a shopping mall. There is a park for wedding registry just right in front of the hotel. This was lovely. Futhermore, it is walking distance to the popular shoppping streets, Orchard Road. However, there is a small problems the moment I enter to the hotel, I smells some funny things. After that, I have clarify that was due to the air conditioning is old and did not well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal”
Reviews.Author: STOLICH
Reviews.Content: A basic, clean, spacious and cheap hotel surrounded by lots of trees. Just spend 4 nights there and would recommend it to any budget travellers. Location is a big plus, within short walking distance to MRT and Orchard Road. Not suitable for men with TROPHY WIFES.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: indush
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Singapore where we stayed at the YWCA Fort Canning Lodge for 4 nights. Plus points - excellent location right next to Dhobi Ghaut MRT and the beautiful, green Fort Canning park, very close to Orchard Road (premium shopping area of Singapore), Clark Quay, Marina Bay - clean and comfortable rooms with great view and all standard amenities (tv, tea coffee maker, mini bar, hair dryer etc); we stayed in a deluxe room on 12th floor. The hotel also has a swimming pool - wholesome buffet breakfast included in the package - friendly and helpful staff -- they gave good tips on sightseeing and even packed a light breakfast for us on the last day since we had an early morning flight - homely ambience well suited for families - overall, great value for money Minus areas - - reception area can sometimes be a bit crowded and noisy as hotel also accommodates many events/classes in its halls. But this did not bother us much as we were mostly in the room or out sightseeing - no room service and the restaurant closes early (around 9:30pm). Again, there are many eating places nearby (e.g. Park Mall which is right next door, or Dhoby Ghaut MRT) Will highly recommend for families who are not looking for destination/boutique hotels but for a very peaceful and comfortable stay at a superb location in Singapore. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “not a happy customer”
Reviews.Author: Janeviar2009
Reviews.Content: The room is not very clean, the pillow smells, aircon was noisy and not cool. Staff are not friendly. Breakfast was average. I booked for 2 nights but decided to stay for only 1 night

Reviews.Title: “Good location & clean”
Reviews.Author: Explorer003
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Singapore last weekend. We chose this hotel based on FMW's review below. Thank you for your spot-on review. This hotel is really well located, it is very clean and our room was really spacious. The hotel has all the necessary facilities, but nothing fancy at all. We didn't mind the basic (no frills) accommodation as we didn't spend much time in the hotel (there are so much to do in Singapore). It was therefore perfect for us. It was clean, spacious, in a good location (2 mins walk from Orchard rd), friendly staff and has a large swimming pool to cool off after a long day of sight seeing. It is a bit expensive for a budget hotel, but I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly good”
Reviews.Author: FMW
Reviews.Content: 1. Perfect location, a few minutes walk from a central MRT station (Dhobi Gaut). Everything of interest radiates out from here. The walk through the covered car park and the lift (four floors) saves the long flight of steps up the steep hill at the side of Park Mall. 2. Perfectly adequate breakfast. We enjoyed the rice and noodles - which, contrary to another review, were different every morning of our 8 night stay, as was the rest of the choice. Plenty of fresh fruit. Coffee poor, but Singapore is not a coffee culture - we didn't get a good cup of coffee anywhere - so it's wise to stick to tea. 3. Evening meals were adequate when we were tired off the long flight.
