However, it was disconcerting to eat alone, and the choice was limited (though tasty). The doorman recommended Plaza Singapura beyond the MRT station- the excellent food hall on Level 6 had good value meals with a wide variety of fantastic food freshly prepared. 4. There's no hotel bar (if that's important to you). We brought duty free spirits with us and bought the mixers locally to keep in the fridge, so it didn't matter to us. Alcohol is very expensive compared to UK - about twice what we'd expect to pay at home. 5. I don't think there's WiFi in the rooms, but we didn't bring a laptop anyway. There's internet access in the lobby, you get a password from the reception desk. 6. Spacious room, freshly decorated (we opted for mid-price Executive with a double bed, rather than cheaper Standard or more expensive Deluxe room). Kept spotlessly clean, but not boutique style - more upmarket college hall of residence. Fridge big enough to chill your bottles of water or tins of mixers. The room was twice as large as one we visited in Ibis Bencoolen (which was claustrophobically small). Our TV and its remote worked fine and the CNN channel gave us all the news we wanted. There's a safe in the huge wardrobe. (One hotel we almost booked was too small for a wardrobe.) 7. Pleasant views of leafy Fort Canning Park on the other side of the road. However, rooms on the other side would look onto Park Mall and may be less appealing. 8. The swimming pool is big enough to do proper lengths, to ease off muscles aching from much walking or sitting on a plane for 12 hours. There were children's swimming lessons every afternoon but there was a generous section left for other swimmers. Basic changing room, but adequate. No jacuzzi to sit in, no poolside bar, no problem. 9. I can't understand the honeymoon couple's review complaining about the house keeping staff coming in unexpectedly - we used the 'do not disturb' sign and the door lock to prevent this, as it can happen at any hotel in the world. The staff always knocked and called several times on the other doors nearby. Housekeeping checks the minibar daily. You can have clean sheets every day if you want; we were given fresh towels daily. 10. It's an interesting place - it's not just a hotel. Courses are run here, there are offices for the YWCA business side. There was always an interesting range of people - all ages, multi-racial, families, business people. It did feel especially safe for women travelling solo. The quiet leafy courtyard is a bonus in a city centre location. Although it's a Christian Association, the Christian message was not intrusive or heavy in any way. 11. I strongly recommend booking through Expedia - you pay up front, so you're not affected by the varying exchange rates, and they give you a lot of support and confidence in a long-established web site. Many other websites don't include the various local taxes in their rates, so you can get an unpleasant surprise (an additional 10% or more) on checking out. 12. My sister and brother-in-law were staying at the Ibis, but said that next time they visit they'll come to Fort Canning Lodge. If the things it doesn't have aren't an issue for you (no bar, flat screen TV, WiFi, spa bubble pool, boutique cushions on the bed, room service), then its price and location make it ideal. We'd have no hesitation in coming back next time.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional in every way!”
Reviews.Author: montysMelbourne
Reviews.Content: It is without any doubt that we recommend this hotel. The staff were most helpful and very warm and friendly. As for their vegetable curry;the best I have tasted! We slept soundly and the beds were just right! We will definitely stay there again and each night after a very busy day exploring Singapore, we looked forward to returning 'home' to our freshly cleaned and comfortable room as well as being welcomed back by the staff. We stayed there for 6 nights and every breakfast was enjoyable as well as the few dinners we had there as well. Unfortunately we did stay at the Ibis hotel for a couple of nights and regretted leaving Fort Canning where everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Better off somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: JemAng
Reviews.Content: After spending 5 days in Bali for our honeymoon, we decided to spend 2 days in Singapore before heading back to reality. Our agent booked us in a very luxurious resort in Bali, and then booked us in Fort Canning Lodge for our Singapore stay. As soon as we arrived..I wondered why our agent chose the place...for a honeymoon trip. When we got there, we found out that our agent mistakenly booked us only for 2 nights, and since we arrived early morning at 2am, the booked 2 nights stay would be separate from our arrival night. We had to shell out $130 and paid it to a VERY arrogant front desk person. And oh yes, the room...it looked like one of those rooms which have not been used for ages. The room and bed smelled..and I was itching the whole night. And the bathroom was dirty. There was a tiny old TV (old meaning, it doesn't come with a remote and you literally switch channels..although there weren't any working channels). At 3am, I was already looking through the yellow pages trying to find another place to stay for that night. I didn't care anymore about the $130 we paid. Picture those run-down motel rooms you see in the movies, and you'd get the idea. The next day, they transferred us to another room, larger and much cleaner..but still basic. With the same kind of TV, and still with no working channels. And as we were getting changed to leave, the cleaner just suddenly went inside our room without knocking..which was kinda embarrassing. Breakfast was so-so..it was the same everyday, and the orange juice was powdered and was not even cold. Location is great, though. It is right in front of the museum and close to a nice park. Also a very nice short walk to the MRT. But for the price, I'd say you'd be better off staying in other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no frills but has everything you need”
Reviews.Author: kit_and_kaboodle
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Fort Canning Lodge a few times and have always found it to be good. The location is fantastic for the money you pay - only one block away from Orchard Road and close to the MRT station. Any other hotels near Orchard Road are much more expensive. The rooms are adequate and clean and the breakfast is good. Staff are not overly helpful and we had no hot water for a while, but this was eventually fixed up. Nothing really to complain about. We don't come here to stay in the hotel all the time - we get out and about and we eat out, so we're only at the hotel to sleep really, and it is perfectly satisfactory for that!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION! The rest... nevermind.”
Reviews.Author: the_hunk
Reviews.Content: I’m from the Philippines and it was our first time to visit Singapore since some of our friends are already working here. I work as a Supervisor in a BPO company, & my colleagues persuaded me to visit this beautiful country in order to unwind. We stayed in YWCA Fort Canning Lodge for 5 days (May 31 – June 4, 2009), and I solely based my decision to the reviews that I saw on this website. Please don't expect too much from this hotel. The reason why I chose this hotel was that it’s the cheapest hotel near Orchard road. The pictures of the hotel that I saw BEFORE our arrival were kind of deceiving. I saw a lot of 3-star hotels even in other countries, and they’re much better than YWCA Fort Canning Lodge. The receptionists are not really friendly and presentable (fusion of Indians and Chinese). Just waiting for our keys (or cards) already took several minutes. The elevators are” low-tech” because you need to insert a guest card in order to use it (most of the time the card has a defect!). I reserved one twin-sharing bedroom online (their website) and when we saw the room (#1116), we were really shocked because it has 1 queen-size bed only (doesn’t look queen-size at all). I called the reception because it really looks like a single bed, and they said that they already upgraded it to an executive room for free (the room is really small and no bath tub). Well, in as much as I wanted to be thankful, it’s difficult because we didn’t expect these “peculiar” service/features of the hotel. By the way, they use a different kind of plug (different than what we are using here in the Philippines) and when we tried to borrow a plug/outlet for our devices, the receptionist was really rude so I just hung up on him because I can’t stand the bad customer service that they’re giving to their customers. He apologized eventually but the damage has been done. To sum it up, it’s bad customer service and below average facilities. The location, however, is GREAT since it’s near the MRT station. This is the only advantage that I saw when we stayed in the hotel. It’s very accessible! The said station is only “2-stations-away” from Orchard Road, which is really ideal for shopping & even “window-shopping”. By the way, they have this GREAT SINGAPORE SALE this month so visit the country for great bargains! Also, the hotel is beside the Park Mall and near Plaza Singapoora (this is a great mall especially if you wanna buy cheap stuffs (better go to Daizo shop, level 5 - I think!). By the way, it’s really hard to get a taxi in Fort Canning so it’s better to just go to the MRT (It’s a cool experience!), only 2 SGD with a refund of $1 when you return the ticket in the machine afterwards. During our last day, I asked the hotel to call a taxi for our transfer us to the airport, and it cost a fixed rate of 35 SGD (around 1,155 Philippine peso) and the airport is really not that far from the hotel. The free breakfast buffet is not good. During our stay in the hotel, they offered the same menu most of the time (chicken franks, nuggets, noodles,etc). Also, during our last day, I was startled because the charges or the bill that I needed to pay became higher. Just a piece of advice (especially to those people who “book” online), don’t trust the figures or prices that you see yet since it doesn’t include the taxes, charges etc. The internet is 5 SGD for 30 minutes, no wifi or internet access in their rooms (you have to pay if you want). The souvenir shop on the ground floor offers cheap souvenirs. The swimming pool is tolerable and child-friendly since its 5 feet only. I would not say that you should not stay in this hotel. The location is great and the room packages are really cheaper compared to other hotels. And this hotel is the CHEAPEST hotel near Orchard road. If you have extra money, I suggest that you find another hotel like the Grand Central or Mandarin. But if you’re in a budget, still wants a good location, and the service/facilities are not an “issue,” then you can stay in this hotel. I posted a lot of pictures to help you decide. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: adventuringindian
Reviews.Content: The YWCA made perfect sense, as it was a money saver, with all the facilities we required: pool, free internet, a large, pleasant room, very very very convenient location, in-house laundrette (self service), and inclusive of breakfast. We were very clear we were going on a holiday to see the city and the sights, not to stay in a hotel, so picking a destination hotel seemed to be a waste. The YWCA was friendly, home-style and just perfectly located next to Orchard road, the malls and the main metro station (60 seconds away), dhoby ghaut. We couldnt have asked for anything more suitable. and the price was a steal. The service was perfect. I would always return there.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean, tasty food, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Ginkonut
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are Singaporeans and we stayed here for 1 night on Friday 8 May 2009 as we were attending a marriage enrichment seminar. We stayed in room 1207 which was on the top floor. The room and bathroom were spacious and clean. The mattress was the bouncy type while we prefer the firm type. Everything worked well (aircon, toilet, shower, kettle, tv, minibar). The wardrobe was big and there was a safe to put your valuables. We saw a full size swimming pool but part of it was cordoned off for swimming lessons during Friday evening and Saturday morning. The MRT train was 5 minutes walk away by going through the Park Mall shopping mall. Orchard Road and a big shopping mall (Plaza Singapura) was 10 minutes walk away. The Chinese set dinner we had on Friday and the Western set lunch we had the next day were tasty and the portion sufficient. The buffet breakfast spread was not wide but good enough and tasted good, especially the silverfish porridge. Overall, my title sums it all up. However, I do not know how much do tourists pay for the rooms so I cannot really comment on the value. If I were a tourist, I may stay here a couple of nights and then move on to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: ap-india
Reviews.Content: For value for money, it is hard to beat this hotel. It is located very conveniently on Orchard Road, with buses and the MRT just a few minutes away*. The rooms, though small (the bathrooms are very small), are well appointed and VERY clean. Breakfast is included in the room rent and is very good. They have wi-fi connectivity in the lobby and wired Net access in the rooms (for a small fee). They have laundry arrangements (coin-operated washing machines and free ironing facilities). (*A tip: go down through the Park Mail parking lot - you get to the main road a lot faster!)

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SydneyRandB
Reviews.Content: Although we booked a double room, we got twin beds. However, the beds were very comfortable. The room was clean and spacious. Breakfast was included in the price. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The shower worked well and the ensuite bathroom was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Budget but Clean”
Reviews.Author: Canboy
Reviews.Content: Budget hotel. Clean. Small bathroom. No carpet. No frills. Very basic. But you get free use of pool and free breakfast. My room was with 2 single beds. Location is near orchard but you have to pass thru a garage building for short cut. If you are on a tight budget, this is the right hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay away from home.”
Reviews.Author: maluPhilippines
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were very nice. Food was very good. Walking distance to the subway and Orchard Road

Reviews.Title: “Good value, could improve in some areas”
Reviews.Author: J_66AP
Reviews.Content: YWCA is centrally located, within walking distance of Orchard Street, as many reviews here already state. Checking in was quite quick, the only drawback was that reception asked for a refundable deposit in case we took anything from the room. This I thought was rather negative, as it clearly demonstrated lack of trust. The twin room we got on one of the higher floors was not bad, with views of buildings around. It was clean enough,though when showering I noticed that the shower tiles had mildew stains on them. Another negative point was that the kettle did not work. There was a TV and it worked alright though. The buffet breakfast was quite good though. (hang on to the coupon as they will ask you for it). There was a spread of boiled and fried eggs, tea and coffee, variety of juices, cereals, toast, ham, fried tomatoes, those fried potatoe things - can't complain it did fill you up. Other than breakfast, location and general cleanliness being ok, (some staff at reception were friendly, others were matter-of-fact) the hotel could improve by fine tuning the things that did not quite reach the mark.

Reviews.Title: “YWCA Fort Cannning Lodge -- a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: starlightShanghai
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 9-day stay at the YWCA Fort Canning Lodge, and I couldn't be happier. The room that I had was large, clean, and quiet. The front desk service was great. All the staff were very helpful and courteous. The breakfasts (included in the price of the room) were excellent. Best of all: the location. This place is a heartbeat away from Fort Canning Park (a must see) and from a major MRT station (Dhoby Ghaut). I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never stayed there but it still cost us”
Reviews.Author: seahorsemama
Reviews.Content: We booked the family room and I made sure they knew it was for a family with 2 teenagers , that is actually 4 adults. They confirmed the booking. We paid a non refundable deposit of SGD$297. About 2 months later they emailed us to say they had cancelled the booking because only 3 adults and a child under 12 can stay in the family room. We made a booking that day with another hotel and it was cheaper.. Fort Canning Lodge refused to refund our deposit despite the fact that they cancelled our booking after confirmation. After emails back and forth they offered us the family room for 4 adults back, but by that time it was too late. Why cancel it in the first place if they were willing to give it back to us. Still no refund and dont expect one but be very careful with this hotel. Also, even though its YWCA, its pretty expensive and you can get a better deal elsewhere in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Y.W.C.A. (You Won't Come Again)”
Reviews.Author: piemanhongkong
Reviews.Content: That's what the taxi drivers said and he was right. My group got booked in all at different intervals. I had to wait 2 1/2 hrs to check in. we had all booked double roooms only to find all twin rooms, beds pushed together. Very musty smell in corridor. The fridge in the room shares the same plug as the TV ...then into the wall socket. Fridge didn't even work. Breakfast was well below par. Coffee was like sludge with grit, orange juice was just coloured water and waiters very gruff with guests. Ate out after that for all meals. Bathroom was horrible. The ceiling didn't even meet the wall, all pipes on display. The shower head was coming off. Water pressure in the sink was a dribble. We paid HK $1000 for a HK$200-300 room. Very overpriced for an old , badly needing renovation hotel. Choose wisely and go and stay in Chinatown, not to far away ; clean smells nice with all amenities surrounding everywhere. The team will not stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, nice location, clean and airy”
Reviews.Author: IndiaAnna
Reviews.Content: We had previously checked into the 81 Bencoolen, for its convenience, pricing and location, but were uncomfortable. We trotted it up to YWCA Fort Canning Lodge to have better accomodation at a slight premium over the previous booking (S$235.00 for a standard twin-bedded double room). The staff at the reception were very accomodating and we stayed there with our two young boys for 5 days. The rooms were spacious and clean. The shower in the bathroom although could be replaced with something more modern or convenient; (you can't direct the flow of water; instead you stand in the way of the jet of water). The buffet breakfast and the self-service laundromat make life a lot more convenient especially when you are travelling with children for many days. All said and done, the Fort Canning Lodge was convenient, situated on the lovely and less visited Fort Canning Rise (where you can go for a lovely walk and visit the Battle Box). The staff were friendly, helpful and cheerful (probably it is a true Christian spirit!!!).

Reviews.Title: “The location is OK...”
Reviews.Author: Saranghae
Reviews.Content: The location is OK...but a bit difficult to explain this hotel to the taxi driver. The standard room size is OK...but the room smells bad and the aircon is quite noisy...the toilet size is a bit small. But it is still acceptable for a hotel in Singapore, a beautiful and enjoyable country.

Reviews.Title: “Safety in numbers”
Reviews.Author: Grumpylady
Reviews.Content: I had a 5 night break whilst on business in the far east and decided to go and visit a couple of friends in Singapore, travelling alone for this part of the trip made me decide to opt for the security of the YWCA, cost was also a factor as I was having to pay for this myself. The location of Fort Canning Lodge is superb, only a few minutes walk to the Dhoby Ghaut MRT station and also within easy walking distance of Orchard road, famous for its shops and restaurants. The downside is perhaps, not unexpectedly, the lack of hotel style facilities, no real service at the front desk but their friendliness makes up for this. The restaurant is very basic and breakfast is hard to recomend, not a huge choice and poor quality food. I found the hotel corridors very noisy until almost midnight with young children racing around screaming, otherwise no real complaints. I might possibly stay here again but only for a short time, 5 nights was just too long.

Reviews.Title: “good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: meeke59
Reviews.Content: For mid budge range of accommodation the YWCA is great. The food was nice as well as most of the staff. Rooms were a nice size, but the whole building is non smoking. The lodge is close to trains, which made accessing the city or Sentosa island easier. Nice place to stay. The pool is located on the 3 floor, but only has 3 lounges, which were often in use. I booked the delux twin room for my girlfriend and myself, and found only a double bed. Staff had to bring in a single bed, which wasn't all that comfortable. All in all this is a nice place to stay for the budget minded person.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short stop over”
Reviews.Author: paulaandrobert
Reviews.Content: Would definitely stay here again and recommend it. Its a very basic hotel. Our room was simply twin beds with a bathroom/shower ensuite. For the price we paid, it included a full buffet breakfast and it has also has a pool which is unusual for a hotel in this price range. One morning we had to catch an early flight and they arranged a simple packed breakfast for us which was appreciated (sandwich, apple and juice). Location is great, right near Orchard Rd and the MRT station. Very clean rooms and very quiet even though the hotel was at capacity. Front desk staff were efficient, a couple almost to the point of rudeness but that perhaps is a cultural difference rather than unfriendly? I would definitely stay here again. For a longer term somewhere nicer would be better but for a couple of nights stop over it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location by MRT”
Reviews.Author: Rosie24Midlands
Reviews.Content: Had booked and had confirmed a twin bedded room but on arrival we were put in room with 1 double bed. Initial reluctance to provide alternative.However, young woman on desk more helpful and by the evening another bed had been put in our room.Clean,comfortable, basic accommodation.Very convenient for MRT and Orchard Rd. Across the road is Fort Canning Park;Battle Box worth a visit. Good pool at hotel; had this to myself for morning swim and a good place to chill after walking round Singapore. Recommend Komala Villas restaurant in Little India. Great food,very cheap,friendly staff.Tasty dosas. MRT is so cheap for travel and there is $1 back each time for return of card. Unbelievably cheap when compared to London. Easy to get from airport to hotel by MRT although try and avoid rush hour. I know you have to go there once, but Raffles really not worth it. Crowded, noisy, extra for tax and (poor) service.The rest of Singapore is much more fun.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible manager and service.”
Reviews.Author: rr4132
Reviews.Content: I was having an absolutely horrible experience. Our reservation could not be found. The staff and manager were not assisting us properly and were very rude. When their credit card reader could not process our credit card, we could not cancel and was forced to pay using cash. Otherwise they will still charge us 25% of the whole stay. Avoid staying in this hotel at all cost.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for!”
Reviews.Author: liz1202
Reviews.Content: My husband and i have stayed at Fort Canning as part of our pre/post Star Cruises (w/c is awesome!) honeymoon. The frontdesk is accommodating, but you can see from their lobby that the hotel has been for ages. It obvious from the furnishings. But regardless of that, the hotel is tidy. Rooms are liitle bit spacious but nothing extraordinary. Its ok because we are not expecting anything fancy w/ this hotel. location is very good since its just a few minutes walking to the Orchard Rd. The breakfast buffet doesnt have a lot of choices and most of their tables are eight seaters. And to mention also, please avoid the period when flock of noisy students gather this place. They are all over the lobby, shouting, talking, running,etc.. You'll feel like your in a campus quadrangle. And it causes me a little headache. Above all, the hotel is just okey. If your not looking for anything fancy, this would be the right hotel since its a good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Bobbi26
Reviews.Content: we were very happy with this hotel, was great value for money, good service and location, lovely breakfast. 10 minutes walk to Orchard rd. Would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: aimesn
Reviews.Content: How I wished I went to this website before I booked into the YWCA hotel. As a frequent traveller in Southeast Asia, I have had my share of bad experiences but for a 3-star hotel like this one, I couldn't believe what I saw. When we first checked in, the room given to us reeked of urine and the toilet seat was broken. Disgusted at what I saw, I requested a room switch which was initially denied by the receptionist. It wasn't until I requested to talk to the manager that I got my room changed. Second room had ants in the washroom floor. Ants. The A/C was ridiculously loud and when the hotel sent up a pest control person to deal with the ants, he ended up overspraying my entire washroom with pesticide. Needless to say, my room stank for the rest of the day. The TV cable was definitely sub-par. On their website, they advertise having nice cable TV, but in reality, there were only about 4 viewable channels with the rest being either fuzzy or difficult to see. 3 Star Hotel Huh? I've had much better TV service in Cambodia costing $10US a night. The service workers in the morning have no utter regard of customer service. I got a knock on my door at 9am from them requesting to inspect my 'minibar' in my room to see whether or not I ate or drank their goods. Without giving her permission, she literally walked into the room, invading our privacy. Frustrated, I demanded some compensation for my horrible experience. Luckily, one of the managers was very accomodating and was probably, the only one qualified in customer service. The best I got was a room upgrade to the 'family suite', not even a discount on the room rate. Sadly, the family suite upgrade also had ants on the table, the TV was fuzzy and even worse, the A/C system made even more noise than ever. At this moment, I was too stressed out and tired with the whole situation to bother making another complaint again. Upon checking out, the billing system wasn't clear at all and it appeared as if I was being double-taxed for the entire stay. I sent an email to the hotel about the situation afterwards and all I received was some non-chalant reply and a message not to submit an internet review of their hotel to 'tarnish their good reputation'. Some customer service I must say. Horrible experience, I really really wished I read this website beforehand and did my own research.

Reviews.Title: “Value fof money”
Reviews.Author: bakasyonista
Reviews.Content: Its a bit late to be writing this review but I still want to post it to help other travellers. We stayed at YWCA last june 2006 for 5 days. I'm with my husband and two kids then ages 10 and 4. Didn't have any bad experience with staff, they were all helpful. Our room is ok, not big but just the right size, its clean and you can expect a peaceful sleep. Bathroom is also ok, no bath tub but the shower is working perfectly. Buffet breakfast was not really a feast but there's enough food selection to satisfy your hunger. It is also very accessible. Short 5 mins. walk to get to MRT station. For the budget conscious family with kids, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tips for Singapore YWCA”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaOn-the-go
Reviews.Content: 12/30 We try to go to Singapore/Malaysia evey year as it is very interesting experience. When we go to Singapore, we have a routinine. It involves,once we arrive, to check in at the YWCA(mem OK/price OK for Singapore). This we have done 6 times, with never a problem. The room is clean,and has a refrigerator/ air conditioning/TV/and a good bathroom with a shower. The two things I like best are: 1.A nice,qood-sized pool outside. It's so good to enjoy the sun.The pool area is nice!! 2. An all-you-can-eat breakfast(comes with the room) that includes a tray of cut papaya. It also means you're so full you can skip cost of lunch. Also it is located conviently near transportation. You don't have to tak an expensive cab. The route is the key(take these instructions with you)--Out the YWCA to the street,go left Get on the sidewalkto the left, Go to the end of the sidewalk and turn left up the down-ramp of the carpark. At the top, turn left. Go until on right are glass auto-open doore. Go thru to the elevator. Take to 1st floor. Out the door is three options: 1. To the rightis a bus stop. Take a buss there to the Botanical Garden. The orchid garden is fantastic!!! 2. Straight across the street, you take an escalator down to MRT underground train syste. It goes to bird park(bus required at the other end)/ downtown/ and orchard street. 3. To the left of MRT station is a multi- story building. This is PLAZA SINGAPURA. A grocery store is to the back, maybe basement?, while there is a really good food court on a higher floos toward the back. Hope this is helpful. Have a good time!!! Don

Reviews.Title: “Stinky room &creepy crawlies”
Reviews.Author: teelee
Reviews.Content: This place was sold to us by our home travel agent as acceptable but for the average tourist I think it's very sub standard. The place has an insect infestation they need to get sorted. The room we were first shown to had a very "toilet"smell if you know what I mean. the room was poorly arranged- we had to re arrange the room just to put our 2 suitcases down. We had trouble with our lift card & got stuck in the lift for 5 mins. We asked for a room change & the reception staff weren't concerned at all. They moved us up a floor but the insect problem was worse.The bedding was stained & the cupboard had old food in it! The plumbing allowed us to smell someone else doing "number 2's". The air conditining had black stuff belching from it onto the white towels. When we went for breakfast the next morning it was like being on one of my kids school camps. Picture dozens & dozens & DOZENS of the local kids with no manners & hungry in the breakfast room. also picture the basic budget breakfast they serve at school camps. Well, that sums up Fort Cannings Breakfast experience!! This place was 3rd class back packer. Shame they had the location cos they don't deserve it. We rang our Holiday Broker & they moved us.....

Reviews.Title: “if you love ants”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The best attribute of this hotel is its location one minute away from Orchard road and MRT station. Tons of places to eat at all prices around. And this is a good news because the breakfast served is really not at standard, except if you like canteen food. The rooms are basic, and although you have a first sense of cleaningness, it is not at its best, or maybe I was not lucky. My room (standard) was full of ants, walking over my toothbrush, climbing the cattle or covering the study table. Very discusting. I have mentioned it three days in the row to the reception but I only got apolodises, no action. Don't expect great facility in your room with regard to internet. For the price, I will not return there and will rather go for a smaller and cheaper hotel in Chinatown, direct by MRT to Orchard. March 2006

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: YWCA is not actually a hotel, as they call it a lodge or some might call is a hostel. But I couldn't see the difference, as it looks like a hotel to me. I stayed in this hotel with my wife and my junior in December 2005, a vacation. If you want to book this hotel, I would suggest book it via internet travel agent, as I only paid USD108 (approx SD180) for two nights stay (SD90 per night) including breakfast for two. If you walk in, the rate will be SD140 per night. My room was upgraded to deluxe room for free during my stay due to all standard rooms being occupied. The room is quite spacious. The floor is wood, no carpet. It's equipped with a queen size bed, standing shower (no bath tub), TV and mini fridge. The fridge has variety of sodas, bottles of cooled mineral water, and also two bowls of instant noodle. The price is approx double the market price, but I guess this is normal. Two packs of free instant coffee and tea each (3-in-1 type). No free drinking water though; you have to boil it yourself with a small kettle. There is a notice stating that all calls made from the room will be charged as same as calls made from public phone, it is by Singtel (one of the three telco). I don't know how true it is as I didn't make any call. At night, it could be a little noisy as what mentioned by other reviewer. The room is not sound proof, I could hear clearly other guest opening and closing their room doors, and also when they speak in the corridor. YWCA only has one restaurant, more like a coffee house actually. It serves breakfast, lunch and dinner, and it close at 9pm. You won't be able to get anything to eat after 10pm as the coffee house is closed, you would have to travel quite far to get a meal, especially after 10pm where shopping malls are closed too. This hostel also doesn't have room service. I guess this is the reason it's not called a hotel. The breakfast is only average. Not many choices, with a fried noodle, fried rice, sausage, toast, fried and boiled egg, salads and that's about it. Juice, tea and coffee are included, of course. During my stay, they have buffet dinner at SD8.80+, it's Chinese dishes, not much choice also, but value for money. Staying in YWCA is very convenient if you travel by MRT, as Dhoby Ghaut MRT station is just across the street. There're few ways to go to the MRT station, I would suggest entering the Park Mall car park, and take a lift to ground floor. Exit Park Mall through the lobby, cross the street and reach the MRT station. If you prefer taxi, it will be quite difficult to wait for a taxi at YWCA, as most taxis will be occupied, unless you pay extra SD2~SD4 to book for a taxi, or wait for someone to arrive at YWCA and take his/her taxi. Orchard Road is just 2 stations (MRT) from Dhoby Ghaut, so does Bugis Junction. Walking and taking MRT to most places of interest is no problem from YWCA. Except Singapore Zoo, which is located quite far from the nearest MRT station, I paid SD4 for a taxi from Zoo to Khatib MRT station. YWCA also has a swimming pool, quite big, not Olympic size though, this is a hostel, remember? Overall, this is a great hotel, or hostel for less than SD100 per night (via internet agent booking). If you are on a budget, just like me, look no further. If money is not an issue, go stay in Orchard road, so that the view could be better, and also a better breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the noisy groups staying”
Reviews.Author: Denise07012
Reviews.Content: Bright and airy reception area. Friendly staff. Coffee shop breakfast was adequate, though their toast machine doesn't work very well. Booked a standard twin room but was given a larger deluxe room with double bed. Bed very comfortable. Not able to get to sleep for first 3 nights of 5 night stay due to large and noisy asian school tour group filling the 9th floor. They yelled and screamed, ran along the halls kicking soft drink plastic bottles. Slamming their doors half the night. Received 3 phone calls during night from children (not sure if it was a prank, or they called wrong room). There was also a 5am fire alarm (that turned out to be a false alarm). Complained twice to reception staff about children, but not much was done. I guess the hotel makes its money from such groups, not single travellers like me. Easy walk through Park Mall, across Penang Road to Dhoby Ghaut MRT station, or across Orchard Road to Plaza Singapura and all the shops. Good for the price, but very noisy when I stayed.

HotelInfo.Name: YWCA Fort Canning Lodge
HotelInfo.Address: 6 Fort Canning Rd, Singapore 179494, Singapore
